meta.title: A presentation on jQuery.tmpl, using jQuery.tmpl
meta.author: skilldrick@gmail.com

slides.title: Templating - Why?
list: Avoid PHP-style mix of logic, content and presentation
Keep content out of the layout
Separation of concerns

slides.title: Why Client-side Templating?
list: Keep UI responsive
Sending HTML updates via Ajax is inefficient
Faster computers and interpreters
Makes sense to do more work in the browser

slides.title: Why jQuery.tmpl()?
list: jQuery is the biggest JS library at the moment
jQuery.tmpl() is its official templating plugin
Developed by Microsoft, under MIT/GPL licence

slides.title: Template Tags
list: {{html}}
{{if}} / {{else}}
{{each}}
{{tmpl}}
{{wrap}}

slides.text: Used for inserting data on the page.

code.content: My name is ${name} and my cat is called ${cat.name}

slides.text: It is possible call simple functions and methods in ${}.

code.content:
I SAID MY NAME IS ${name.toUpperCase()}!

But you can call me ${fun(name)}

slides.title: {{html}}
slides.text: ${} escapes HTML, but {{html}} passes it through untouched.

slides.title: {{if}} / {{else}}
slides.text: Used for conditional execution of template code.

code.content:
{{if important}}

It's our most valued customer, ${name}!

{{/if}} {{else}}

Hi there ${name}.

{{/else}}

slides.title: {{each}}
slides.text: Used to iterate over an array within a template.

code.content:
{{each numbers}}

${$index + 1}. Please enter the number ${$item} in your terminal.

{{/each}}

slides.title: {{tmpl}}
slides.text: Used to render sub-templates. Can be passed a single item or an array.

slides.title: {{wrap}}
slides.content: Used to wrap content in one template with markup in another.

slides.title: Template meta-variables
slides.text: There are some special variables that can be used within templates:
list: $data: The current data item being processed
$item: The current template item
$value: The current value in {{each}}
$index: The current index in {{each}}

slides.title: Rendering collections
list: Pass array to .tmpl() - each item will be rendered
Inside template, pass array to {{tmpl}} for sub-template
Or pass array to {{each}} to iterate within the template
